intro: Polybotrya attenuata, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals.
